PLEASE NOTE: This event is run by Fitchburg State College. There is an admission fee but it is open to the public. Go here > http://www.fsc.edu/cu... for more info

Fitchburg State faculty member Richard McElvain will recreate his acclaimed performance in scenes from Bertolt Brecht’s play “The Life of Galileo,” with additional characters being performed by Fitchburg State students.

Each of the scenes will be contextualized by McElvain and the actors, who will step out of character to address the audience and connect remarkable moments from Brecht’s play highlighting Galileo’s impact, exploring the tensions between accepted common knowledge and scientific discovery. The performances will be followed by a conversation with McElvain and his fellow faculty scholars, Bruce Duncan and John Paul.

Scenes from “The Life of Galileo” will be presented on Tuesday, Oct. 5, at 7 p.m. in Percival Auditorium. Tickets are $5 for the public and $3 for students, and available at the door.
item.name: Humanist Ed' Night: Scenes from “The Life of Galileo” @ Fitchburg State College
